definition: to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...

sentences.english: So I really feel that I owe them a lot.
sentences.chinese: 所以我真的覺得虧欠粉絲們很多。

sentences.english: Maybe you can never tell that love is correct or wrong, and there is no one owing to the other.
sentences.chinese: 也許，愛情從來沒分對與錯，也沒有誰虧欠誰。

sentences.english: This is a betrayal of what we owe our servicemen and women.
sentences.chinese: 這也是我們對軍中服役的他和她的虧欠。

sentences.english: Her mother lost her job a long time ago and has always felt that she is indebted to her current husband.
sentences.chinese: 她媽媽很久以前就失業了，總覺得虧欠現在的丈夫。

sentences.english: You have been weighed on the scales (of God) and found wanting.
sentences.chinese: 你被秤在天平裏，顯出你的虧欠。

definition: guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to worry about/to be concerned about
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive

unilateral/one-sided/home remedy/folk prescription(same as 丹方)/single-drug prescription (same as 奇方[ji1 fang1], one of the seven kinds of prescriptions of Chinese medicine 七方[qi1 fang1])/metaphorically. a good solution
